text: Elling Enger (22 February 1905 - 28 January 1979) was a Norwegian composer, organist, and choir conductor. == Biography == Enger was born in Skotfoss, Norway, and got his musical educated at the Conservatory of Music in Oslo. He worked as organist in Tromsø (1930–36), and later as organist and choir conductor in Oslo. He has written the song "Bli med, bli med til livet!" ("Join, join in to life!"), as well as cantatas, orchestra pieces, motets, organ works, and the like. == References == == External links == *Biography at Store Norske Leksikon Category:Norwegian classical organists Category:Male organists Category:Norwegian male classical composers Category:20th-century Norwegian composers Category:Norwegian classical composers Category:20th- century classical composers Category:Norwegian contemporary classical composers Category:Norwegian Academy of Music alumni Category:Musicians from Skien Category:1905 births Category:1979 deaths Category:20th-century organists Category:20th-century Norwegian male musicians
title: Elling Enger
